newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russians, rebels sign deal in Chechnya.
newsitem.headline: Russians, rebels sign deal in Chechnya.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin's security supremo Alexander Lebed and Chechen rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov signed a deal on Thursday aimed at ending three weeks of renewed fighting in the region.

The final contents of the document negotiated in this village south of the Chechen capital Grozny have not been officially disclosed. Itar-Tass news agency said it provided for the disengagement of Russian and rebel forces in Chechnya.
